ArticleTitle.sentence: A novel SP-1 site in the human interleukin-1 beta promoter confers preferential transcriptional activity in keratinocytes.

event.clue: A novel SP-1 site in the human interleukin-1 beta promoter confers preferential transcriptional activity in keratinocytes.

AbstractText.sentence: To investigate the mechanisms of transcriptional activation of interleukin-1beta (IL-1beta) in non-monocytic cells, we constructed a series of reporter plasmids with the bacterial chloramphenicol acetyltransferase gene linked to various parts of the human IL-1beta promoter and performed transient transfection experiments.

event.clue: To investigate the mechanisms of transcriptional activation of interleukin-1beta (IL-1beta) in non-monocytic cells, we constructed a series of reporter plasmids with the bacterial chloramphenicol acetyltransferase gene linked to various parts of the human IL-1beta promoter and performed transient transfection experiments.

AbstractText.sentence: We identified a promoter segment that activates transcription most efficiently in keratinocytes.

event.clue: We identified a promoter segment that activates transcription most efficiently in keratinocytes.

AbstractText.sentence: Electrophoretic mobility shift assays (EMSA) with a 43-mer oligonucleotide derived from the functionally identified cis-acting element revealed specific complexes.

By competition analysis with transcription factor consensus sequence oligonucleotides and by immunosupershift, transcription factor SP-1 or a closely related protein was shown to bind to this regulatory element.

event.clue: By competition analysis with transcription factor consensus sequence oligonucleotides and by immunosupershift, transcription factor SP-1 or a closely related protein was shown to bind to this regulatory element.

By competition analysis with transcription factor consensus sequence oligonucleotides and by immunosupershift, transcription factor SP-1 or a closely related protein was shown to bind to this regulatory element.

AbstractText.sentence: The closest match to the known SP-1 consensus sequence within the respective region is a TCCCCTCCCCT motif.

Mutation of this motif almost completely, and specifically, abolished the binding of two low-mobility complexes and led to a 95% decrease of constitutive transcriptional activation of a reporter construct IL-1beta (-170/+108).

event.clue: Mutation of this motif almost completely, and specifically, abolished the binding of two low-mobility complexes and led to a 95% decrease of constitutive transcriptional activation of a reporter construct IL-1beta (-170/+108).

Mutation of this motif almost completely, and specifically, abolished the binding of two low-mobility complexes and led to a 95% decrease of constitutive transcriptional activation of a reporter construct IL-1beta (-170/+108).

AbstractText.sentence: Likewise, activation of this reporter construct by tumor necrosis factor-alpha depended on the SP-1 site.

event.clue: Likewise, activation of this reporter construct by tumor necrosis factor-alpha depended on the SP-1 site.
Likewise, activation of this reporter construct by tumor necrosis factor-alpha depended on the SP-1 site.

AbstractText.sentence: These observations suggest that a so-far-unrecognized SP-1 site in the human IL-1beta promoter may participate in the transcriptional regulation of this gene in keratinocytes.

event.clue: These observations suggest that a so-far-unrecognized SP-1 site in the human IL-1beta promoter may participate in the transcriptional regulation of this gene in keratinocytes.
These observations suggest that a so-far-unrecognized SP-1 site in the human IL-1beta promoter may participate in the transcriptional regulation of this gene in keratinocytes.
